Lecture.Description: - All java applications are all multi-threaded, even hello - world ! - A System thread - is created by the JVM and runs in the background of application. For ex: Garbage collector - when encounters a problem can't recover and generates java error instead of exception. (for ex: run out of memory) - A user-defined thread - created by app developer to accomplish a specific task - we can consider applications as single threaded when there is only one user-defined thread. So we may omit system threads.
